meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - Get ready for some serious cat-titude!

As a seasoned grok (that's gamer speak for "old and wise," folks), I'm excited to dive into the world of Cat Quest, an action RPG that's all about feline fun. And let me tell you, it's purr-fectly charming.

First off, kudos to the developers for creating a game that's aware of its goofy setup and leans into the cat puns and antics. I mean, who doesn't love a good cat joke? It's like the game is saying, "Hey, we know this is ridiculous, but let's just have fun with it!" And you know what? It works.

Now, I know some of my fellow critics (ahem, Digitally Downloaded) might say that Cat Quest lacks depth and becomes repetitive. But hey, who doesn't love a good cat nap every now and then? And when the game is this cute and charming, I'm willing to overlook those minor quibbles.

But let's get real for a sec - what really matters is the gameplay. And on that front, Cat Quest delivers. The combat is solid, the exploration is engaging, and the cat-themed everything (because, of course, it's all about the cats) is just so much fun. I mean, who wouldn't want to play as a brave feline warrior, battling baddies and saving the day?

Now, I know some of you might be thinking, "But what about the reviews?" Well, let me tell you - while the critics may have had their differences, they all agree that Cat Quest is a fun game. And who are we to argue with those esteemed reviewers? (Worth Playing: 78, Nintendo Life: 70, SpazioGames: 60, NintendoWorldReport: 70, God is a Geek: 80, Cubed3: 70, Digitally Downloaded: 60)

So there you have it - Cat Quest is a delightful little game that's all about having fun. And if you're anything like me (old and wise), you'll be purr-fectly happy to spend your time exploring the world of Cat Quest.

And remember - when life gives you lemons, make lemonade. But when life gives you cats, make a cat RPG!
